oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Greene, Jenkins - Letter 2
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Greene, Colton; Jenkins, Albert Gallatin; politics; correspondence;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Colton Greene, St. Louis, to Albert Gallatin Jenkins, House of Representatives, Washington City: urges Gallatin to be a "looker-on" and avoid taking rash actions; warns against underestimating the strengths of others; laments "southern political sagacity" in the handling of the "Kansas imbroglio"; asserts that now is not the time "to fight the negro question"; urges that Douglas (Stephen A. Douglas, Dem. Senator of Illinois) no longer be given support; explains that lack of money prevents visit to Washington this winter and will instead "play the Philosopher."
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Manuscript collection processed by John Jones
